Question 120) In 2011, a failure in the drilling process carried out by a oil company caused oil spill in the Campos watershed in Rio de Janeiro.
The impacts arising from this spill occur because the components of oil
A) react with seawater and suffer degradation, generating compounds with high toxicity.
B) Acidify the environment, promoting the wear of limestone shells of mollusks and the death of corals.
C) dissolve in the water, causing the mortality of marine beings by ingestion of contaminated water.
D) have hydrophobic character and low density, preventing gas exchanges between the aquatic environment and the atmosphere.
E) They have a small and high volatility chain, contaminating the local and regional atmosphere according to the winds in the sea borders.
